en.title: Your divorce
en.name: Name
en.youCanNowFinaliseYourDivorce: You can now finalise your divorce
en.mainBody: The 6 week waiting period has passed. You can now complete the divorce and get a decree absolute.
en.whenYouNeedToApplyBy: When you need to apply by
en.detail1: You can apply for your decree absolute any time from now. If you apply after 3 June 2020 (1 year after the decree nisi was granted) you’ll have to explain the delay to the court.
en.detail2: The court can cancel (legally known as rescind) the decree nisi any time up until the decree absolute is granted, if it’s given new evidence showing why you should'nt be given a divorce.
en.detail4: Your husband/wife can apply for the decree absolute from 3 April 2019 (3 months after you can). If your husband/wife applies you’ll both need to go to a court hearing.
en.howRespondsLink: How your {{ case.divorceWho }} responds
en.decreeNisiLink: Decree nisi
en.decreeAbsoluteLink: Decree absolute
en.childrenAndDivorceLink: Children and divorce
en.moneyAndPropertyLinky: Money and property
en.downloadAndSaveYourDocuments: Download and save all the documents for this application before you continue. If you do amend your application, you won’t be able to access any of these documents online anymore.
